data.title: Network of Care for Behavioral Health Services
data.text:
Drug Disposal

Search by ZIP code:

Drug disposal sites and organizations allow for the safe handling and disposal of unneeded prescription drugs. Below are resources for locating drug disposal locations and information.

USDA Unused Medicine Disposal

Needle Exchange

Search by ZIP code:

Needle exchange sites and organizations allow for the safe handling and disposal of used syringes, while allowing for persons to acquire clean needles in order to reduce the risk of communicable diseases like HIV or Hepatitis C.

Safe Needle Disposal Resources

North American Syringe Exchange Database Map

Naloxone-Carrying Pharmacies

Search by ZIP code:

Naloxone is a life-saving medication that can reverse the effects of an opioid overdose. Find a pharmacy that can perscribe Naloxone.

National Harm Reduction Coalition

Get Naloxone Now

Buprenorphine Practitioners

Search by ZIP code:

Buprenorphine is the first medication to treat opioid use disorder that can be prescribed or dispensed in physician offices, significantly increasing access to treatment. Find a practitioner who can prescribe Buprenorphine.

What is Buprenorphine?

HRSA-Supported Health Centers

Search by ZIP code:

HRSA-supported health centers are supported by the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services Health Resources and Services Administration. Health centers are community-based and patient-directed organizations that serve populations with limited access to health care.

Wellness Recovery Action Plan (WRAP)

Learn more about Mary Ellen Copeland's Wellness Recovery Action Plan (WRAP), the format for organizing wellness tools into action plans in order to deal with life's challenges, especially those related to mental illness.

Learn more
